alert.note: Alert for Rio Arriba (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 7:09PM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Mexico... Rio Chama Near Chamita affecting Rio Arriba County. Rio Ojo Caliente Below La Madera affecting Rio Arriba County. Los Pinos River at Ortiz affecting Rio Arriba County. .Snow melt and increased reservoir releases will keep river flows high. Expect minor flooding, including areas downstream from the Abiquiu dam. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast to continue. * WHERE...Rio Ojo Caliente below La Madera. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Farm and pasture land is being inundated, and irrigation channels and gates may be severely damaged if high flows persist. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM MDT Friday the stage was 6.32 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:00 PM MDT Friday was 7.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 7.3 feet Saturday. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.3 feet on 06/19/1966. - http://www.weather.gov/abq/EmergencyPrepFlood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Rio Ojo Caliente La Madera 7.0 7.34 Fri 6 pm MDT 7.3 7.2 7.2 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning around 1000 AM MDT.
